partners.delinquency_rate_note: Fondo Esperanza's loans at risk rate currently appears to be 100%. Though lenders will not have recieved payment from their clients yet, this rate is a measurement of the partner's (Fondo Esperanza's) loans at risk rate, rather than their client's. Because Fondo Esperanza and Kiva recently decided to end this partnership and therefore Fondo Esperanza is no longer raising loans through Kiva, the repayment process will be effected as Fondo Esperanza decides how best to return lenders their funds (each month; all at once; etc). Kiva and Fondo Esperanza are working on this issue and thank you for your patience!

partners.default_rate_note: Maya's delinquency rate often appears higher than the average for Kiva Field Partners. However, this is not because the organization is experiencing an unusually high number of borrowers behind on repayment. To lower the costs of transferring funds, Kiva allows its partners to wait until repayments exceed $5,000 to repay. For small institutions like Maya that have a low outstanding balance with Kiva, this delay sometimes results in higher delinquency rates.

partners.default_rate_note: Grameen Foundation AppLab's default rate appears as 78.05% because Kiva calculates the default rate by dividing the unsettled amount for all defaulted loans by the total principal for all loans in “ended” status. The only loan from Grameen Foundation AppLab that has ended is one in which the borrower passed away and therefore the loan ended in default. Since all its other loans have still not ended, the default rate is currently 78.05%.

partners.default_rate_note: Please note that LEDC’s default rate appears higher than it is for other Kiva Field Partners. This is not because the organization is experiencing an unusually high level of defaults. Rather, as a partner with loan terms averaging over 2 years, LEDC has had few loans end. Because we calculate the default rate by dividing the number of defaulted loans by the number of ended loans, the organization's default rate appears much higher than it does for partners that offer shorter loan terms.

partners.default_rate_note: In May 2014, three of Lumni Chile's loans on Kiva were accidentally defaulted in Kiva's system. This does not effect the clients' payments in actuality and Kiva and Lumni have every expectation that the clients will continue paying off their loans for the duration of their loan term. Though these clients will appear as "Defaulted" and anonymized on Kiva's website, and Lumni Chile's default rate will appear artificially inflated, we want to stress that this does not reflect their arrears in reality. Kiva apologies for this confusion and is working with the field partner to fix this issue so it does not occur moving forward.

social_performance_strengths.description: These Field Partners use feedback from the people they serve and adapt their business practices and product offerings to meet their needs.

social_performance_strengths.name: Family and Community Empowerment
social_performance_strengths.description: These Field Partners offer support services that address the needs of their clients’ families: their health, education, and/or well-being.

social_performance_strengths.name: Entrepreneurial Support
social_performance_strengths.description: These Field Partners offer training and support to help people start, manage and grow their businesses.

social_performance_strengths.name: Innovation
social_performance_strengths.description: These Field Partners embrace technology and innovation to better address the needs of the people they serve.
